alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 28 at 12:55PM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Elko has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Nevada... Salmon Falls Creek Near Salmon Falls Creek near San Jacinto affecting Elko County. .Warm daytime temperatures along with low temperatures remaining above freezing overnight will accelerate snow melt. River flows will increase quickly and could remain high for the next week. For the Salmon Falls Creek...including Salmon Falls Creek near San Jacinto...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Salmon Falls Creek Near Salmon Falls Creek near San Jacinto. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Minor flooding occurs along the banks of Salmon Falls Creek. Water from Salmon Falls Creek begins entering the Salmon Falls Creek rest area along U.S. 93, about 3 miles south of Jackpot, NV. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM PDT Friday the stage was 8.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate below flood stage with a maximum value of 9.7 feet late tomorrow evening. - Action stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday afternoon at 200 PM PDT.
